doc.field: Testing my new Nikon D90 camera and first time on the Hi-Flyer balloon in Berlin-Mitte. A view over the inner city of Berlin. In the center in the back you can see the Alexanderplatz with the TV tower. A little to the left is the Berlin Cathedral. In the center front is the Gendarmenmarkt with the French and German cathedral.
city panorama berlin germany deutschland nikon sigma wideangle berlinmitte d90 hiflyer grabthar sebastianniedlich nikond90 sigmaex1020456dchsm
The inside of the Berliner Dom in HDR. You can see that the building has been modeled after the Peter's Cathedral in Rome.

Panorama made out of three exposures. It's the Lustgarten with its fountain in Berlin-Mitte. In the background the Berlin cathedral. The almost gone building on the right is the former East German parliament.

Night HDR made of 5 exposures showing the Berlin Cathedral. The weather was quite bad with the sky a mess of clouds and fog. I think it turned out quite decent anyway.

Festival Of Lights 2009: The Cathedral HDR

Contrary to the former years the backside of the Cathedral was illuminated too and had different laser patterns swirling around. Part of the <a href"http:www.flickr.comphotos42311564@N00sets72157602479821841">Festival Of Lights set<a>, featuring pictures from the the former festivals, too.

Festival Of Lights 2008: Backside Of The Cathedral
A kid playing on the fountain located in the "Lustgarten" (pleasure garden) of Berlin. It's pretty much in front of the Berlin Dome.
sun berlin water fountain kids lights cathedral mitte s70 lustgarten berlinmitte berlincathedral grabthar sebastianniedlich sonydscs70

Exhibition in Berlin's senate office of city planning. What you see here is a small view of a quite large model with the changes (shown in brown) that the city already went through or will get through. Looks significant, doesn't it? This is the area around the famous boulevard "Unter den Linden" and around the Berlin dome. If you look closely at the upper right corner there is a building in a lighter brown. That is the planned reconstruction of the Berlin Citypalace which was destroyed by the government of the GDR after the war. The "people's palace" that was built in its place is being torn down right now.

The organ side of the cathedral. Below the organ are some coffins of the Hohenzollern family.
